simplesect.title: Keys/Mouse actions and window attributes
simplesect.para: Here is the list of all possible actions and attributes. First table shows all toggleable attributes. Toggleable attributes are controlled using the Set, Unset and Toggle actions. Examples below.

row.entry: If a frame is maximized. Two parameters, first one decides if the frame is maximized horizontally, the second if it is maximized vertically.
If a frame should be shaded (so that only the titlebar shows until it's unset or toggled off).
If a frame should be iconified.
If a frame should be sticky so it appears on every workspace.
If frame should allways be on top of other frames.
If a frame should allways be below other frames.
If frame should have a titlebar.
If a frame should be fullscreen. Fullscreen frame takes over the whole desktop ignoring any harbour or struts and becomes decorless.
If a frame is marked for later attaching (with AttachMarked).
If a frame should swallow all new clients until unset or toggled off. One parameter, if true new clients open in the background. Defaults to false.
If a frame should be ignored on specified places, string is one of menus, focustoggle, snap.
Changes the clients titlebar text to string when set. Unsetting returns the clients title text back to the client specified one.

When things to be done to this window requested by the client program should be denied, string is one of, position (don't let the client move the window), size (don't let the client resize the window), stacking (don't allow the client to raise or lower the window), activewindow (don't let client give input focus), maximizedvert (don't let client maximize a window vertically), maximizedhorz (don't let client maximize window horizontally), hidden (don't let client hide window), fullscreen (don't let client set window fullscreen mode), above (don't let client place window above other windows), below (don't let client place window below other windows).
If all autogrouping should be in use or not. By default it's set, as in autogrouping is enabled.

Acts much like Maximize, but considers other frames while doing it. Instead of filling the whole screen, it only grows to hit the borders of neighboring frames. Takes two parameters, first one decides if the frame is maxfilled horizontally, the second if it should be maxfilled vertically.
Closes a frame and all client windows in it.
Kills a client window, use if close doesn't work.
Raises a frame above other frames. If bool is true raises a frame and all of the currently active clients child/parent windows above other frames.
If the frame this action is used on is not focused, focuses it. If the frame is focused, raises it. If used on a groups titlebar, activates the selected client of the group.
Lowers a frame under other frames. If bool is true lowers a frame and all of the currently active clients child/parent windows under other frames.
Moves the focus and raises a client inside a frame relative to the currently selected client. Int is 1 to move right, -1 to move left.
Moves the current clients position inside the current frame. Int is 1 to move right, -1 to move left.

Shows a menu. String is menu typy, one of root, icon, goto, gotoclient, window, decor, attachclient, attachframe, attachclientinframe, attachframeinframe. Bool is true for sticky menus, false for click to vanish. Defaults to false.

Shows the command dialog that can be used to input pekwm actions. If it's a window specific action, it affects the window focused when CmdDialog was summoned. If entered action doesn't match any valid pekwm action, pekwm tries to Exec it as a shell command.
Attachs all marked clients to the current frame.
Attachs client to the next frame.
Attachs client to the previous frame.
Attachs frame to the next frame.
Attachs frame to the previous frame.
Detach the current client from its frame.
Searches the client list for a client that has a title matching the given regex string.
Executes a program, string is a path to an executable file.

Focuses the first window on the direction specified, and optionally raises it. Takes two options, first one is the direction and the second specifies if the focused frame should be raised or not. Bool defaults to True. String is one of up,down,left,right.
Activates the #th client of a frame. Int is the client number.
Activates the keyboard move and resize.

Moves the frame to the specified place on the screen. String is one of TopLeft, TopEdge, TopRight, RightEdge, BottomRight, BottomEdge, BottomLeft, LeftEdge, Center, TopCenterEdge, BottomCenterEdge, LeftCenterEdge, RightCenterEdge.
Focuses the next frame. parameters define if frame is raised while toggled, only at the end of the toggling, or not raised at all. String is one of alwaysraise, endraise, neverraise.
Focuses the previous frame. parameters define if frame is raised while toggled, only at the end of the toggling, or not raised at all. String is one of alwaysraise, endraise, neverraise.

Focuses the next frame so that the last focused windows will get switched to first. Parameters define if frame is raised while toggled, only at the end of the toggling, or not raised at all. String is one of alwaysraise, endraise, neverraise.

Focuses the previous frame so that the last focused windows will get switched to first. Parameters define if frame is raised while toggled, only at the end of the toggling, or not raised at all. String is one of alwaysraise, endraise, neverraise.

Changes workspaces. Goes to a workspace number defined, or goes to the next or previous workspace, or goes to the left or right workspace. Prev and next workspaces wrap around to the furthest away workspace after the last workspace is reached. String is one of next, prev, left, right, or a workspace number.
Grows the frame in one of the directions up to the edge of the head. String is one of up, down, left, right.
Sends a frame to the specified workspace. String is one of next, prev, left, right, or a workspace number.
Quits pekwm and starts the program you specify. String is a path to an executable file.
Move viewport view to wanted coordinates. Takes two parameters, first is x, the second y.
Move viewport this many pixels. Parameters can be negative or positive integers. First integer is x, second y.
Change viewport. Two parameters, first integer is the column, second the row.
Changes the current viewport position. String is one of up, down, left, right
Resizes a frame. String is one of top, bottom, left, right, topleft, topright, bottomleft, bottomright.
Activates a client of a frame.
Drags windows in and out of frames, if parameter is true dragged windows go in the background of a frame.
Makes a dragged window warp to specified workspace when a it's moved over a screen edge. String is one of next, prev, left, right, or a workspace number.
Makes a dragged window warp to specified viewport when a it's moved over a screen edge. String is one of up, down, left, right
Moves a frame horizontally. Int is amount of pixels and can be negative.
Moves a frame vertically. Int is amount of pixels and can be negative.
Resizes a frame horizontally. Int is amount of pixels and can be negative.
Resizes a frame vertically. Int is amount of pixels and can be negative.
Snaps the frame to the closest frames or screenedges.
Cancels all moveresize actions and keeps the frame how it was before them.
Aknowledges the moveresize actions and moves/resizes the frame as wished.
Closes a menu or a CmdDialog.
Erases the previous character according to the cursor position.
Moves CmdDialog cursor one characer space to right.
Moves CmdDialog cursor one characer space to left.
Moves CmdDialog cursor to the beginning of the line.
Moves CmdDialog cursor to the end of the line.
Browses previously used CmdDialog lines towards the oldest issued.
Browses previously used CmdDialog lines towards the newest issued.
Executes the entered line of pekwm actions from CmdDialog. Not to be confused with the general Exec available everywhere (see above).
Allows for the keypress to be inputted to the text field of CmdDialog. Usually used to allow any other keys than the ones used for CmdDialog browsing.
